title: Old Qantas Logo Font?
content:
I’m wondering if this is an actual font like this or if it’s custom. Any clues? TIA!

[http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1337/914737049\_1548d3776b.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705150701/http:/farm2.static.flickr.com/1337/914737049_1548d3776b.jpg "http://farm2.static.flickr.com/1337/914737049\_1548d3776b.jpg")

 [‹ Design Can Change...What typeface is this?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705150701/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40941 "Go to previous forum topic") [Fraktur font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705150701/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40944 "Go to next forum topic")
author: popstalin

comments.content:
Judging from the propeller-powered Lockheed Constellation airliner, this ad is from the early 50’s, well before digital fonts as we know them, and maybe even ahead of most film type. The very open C and S don’t seem common in type samples I see from that era, so my inclination is to think it’s custom lettering and probably not a commercial typeface.

- Mike Yanega
[Calcite](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705150701/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/calcite/) has a similar feel to it.
